text: A pair of hands rifles through the pages of a book. Disca it and grabs another. The process repeats until a folded ARTICLE is revealed, nestled within a hardback. A slender yet handsome figure -- we don’t get a good look his face, but we’ll learn this is ALEX LINDEN (27) -- unf and scans the pages. He stuffs them in his suit jacket, g his cell phone and walks downstairs towards...

Alex gets in the tub, raising the steaming water to the b Grabs his phone and scans Twitter (@AlexLinden). New mess cascade down the screen. He types: Ask for me tomorrow, a you shall find me a grave man. Clicks “Tweet.” His messag joins a rushing tide and tumbles down the page, out of si He drops his phone in the bath, revealing his stricken fa
An office building around midtown. A lonely figure is illuminated at his desk by the glare of florescent light.

Phones ring. Shouts reverberate across the open room. Mid aged men with stained shirts and considerable guts bluste down aisles of desks holding mock-ups of tomorrow's paper BEN KAPLAN (27) -- tall and reedy, and more contemplative than most -- takes a big gulp of coffee and hunches over computer. We GLIMPSE what looks like a fledgeling novel: words “Chapter Two” and a whole lot of white space.
Ben. Your pages set? Ben CLICKS AWAY quickly to a newspaper layout. The NIGHT EDITOR slows as he nears but doesn’t stop.

Yeah, yeah. Almost. Ben turns to his computer. SCROLLS to reveal A PHOTO of in a penis costume getting arrested. An empty headline fi waiting to be filled. Ben’s cell phone RINGS, breaking his concentration.
Goddammit, Alex. But Ben doesn’t recognize the number. Decides to answer i
Hello? Yeah I’m at work so-- (a beat) Please tell me this is a sick joke. Ben looks like he’s been hit by a ton of bricks. He CHECK HIS MISSED CALLS: It’s “Alex Linden” all the way down.

SIRI HOPKINS (26) -- beautiful, arty, ethereal -- turns a opened envelope over and over in her hands. Reopens it: “Dear Ms. Siri Hopkins: Congratulations! You have been na a J. Liddle Urban Architectural Fellow for 2013...” Siri refolds the letter. Feels a heady mix of elation and dread. She hears KEYS JANGLING IN THE HALLWAY and loses h nerve. Flicks off the bedside light and lies back in bed. The DOOR OPENS and Ben appears, silhouetted by the hallwa fluorescents. He sheds his clothes while Siri feigns slee Slips into bed and holds her from behind. Siri stirs.
Good day? Ben buries his face in the nape of Siri’s neck.
Siri. It’s... Siri opens her eyes and turns to fix Ben with her gaze.
Hey. What happened?
It’s Alex.
Students walk briskly across dewy quads. PRE-LAP: A PHONE RINGS.
JOSH LIPSCHITZ (27) -- a spectacled, ill-shaven mess -- i startled from sleep. His desk is covered in booze, books, cigarettes. He knocks them over while groping for his pho

I had a freshman roommate named Ben, but that ass wad hasn’t called in ages. (takes in the bad news) Oh fuck. Fuck me! Well I’m not going. (listens) Because I’m not, okay? Josh hangs up and blinks his eyes silently for a moment. Suddenly possessed, he gathers up his belongings. On his out, he slams a Post-it over the NAME PLATE on his door: Office Hours Cancelled.
SARAH GALLO (26) -- pantsuit, plain, yet wholesomely pret ducks her head down near her desk, talking quietly into h cell phone. The firm buzzes with activity around her.

Oh my God. Are you serious? Of course you are. What a stupid question. I'll... train up as soon as I can, okay? Sarah struggles to keep her emotions in check.  10 A mountain of papers lands WITH A THUD on her desk. She e her call and looks up to see a SENIOR ASSOCIATE, smiling cynically. Sarah smiles back, wiping away a stray tear. S picks up the office phone and dials.
ISAAC SMITH (27) -- warm eyes, bespoke suit -- walks bris by a PERSONAL SECRETARY into his office, talking on a headset. The San Francisco Bay gleams outside his window.
Sarah. Sarah! Calm down. Take a breath. At least he’s alive, right? He hears THE BEEP OF CALL WAITING. Sees a picture of KATE MURPHY (22) -- California pretty and young -- on his phon

Shoot. Hold on one second, okay? (clicking over) Hey baby. Yeah, I’m fine. I think I’m just gonna book myself a flight and leave the office now. Isaac keeps one eye on the Dow and another on a travel website. His face tells us he’s said the wrong thing.

Of course I want you there with me. I just don’t want this to have to be a big thing for you... Okay, okay! Here. I’11 book us both right now. Sound good? Talk soon. (clicking back) Sarah, you there? I’m so sorry.
INT. SIRI’S CAR, UPSTATE NEW YORK - EARLY AFTERNOON 10 Siri drives her old Saab while Ben navigates via iphone.
Here. This one. Siri doesn’t have enough time to react. They both watch a their intended exit zips by. Siri sighs.
What does it say now?
It’s “recalculating”...
Then what am I supposed to--
I don’t know. Siri turns right.
Do you know when he’1l be able to be released?
I think tonight. Maybe tomorrow morning. Keep going straight. Siri absorbs Ben’s anxiety. Calculates whether this is th best time to spill her secret. It’s not. But fuck it.
I got the fellowship. Ben’s floored.
Wow.
So...
When were you planning on telling me?
I’m doing it now.
But how long have you known?
I found out yesterday but it didn’t really... seem like the right time. (a beat) So...  15
I’m really happy for you. It’s a great opportunity.
I know. I meant about us. Moving out there. Do I turn up here?
No. Go straight... Siri you know I... I can’t just quit my job and move to LA.
Why not?
Because newspapers aren’t hiring. They're laying people off.
You don’t even like your job.
Well I like not-liking it.
I can’t believe you're doing this while we’re on our way up to--
Hold on. Can we just... table this?
Table our relationship?
No. I mean. Press pause. Just focus on Alex. Don’t let everyone in on our own... stuff. Siri looks at Ben. This is the opposite of how she hoped talk might go but she’s just as happy to drop it.
Yeah. Sure. Of course. I’m sorry.
Ben and Siri pull up to a rundown house tucked in the woo and get out of the car. Ben tries breaking the tension.
Remember when we first came here? Place looks worse than it did. Siri chooses silence in lieu of a reply. Ben finds a key hidden under a rock.
Ben and Siri wander, taking in the mess: bowls everywhere cigarette butts, the place dusty and suffocating. They pi up dishware and open windows, moving in silence.
(checking her watch) Sarah's train should be getting in.
I’'1l wait here for the others. Siri turns to go. Ben catches her wrist. Kisses her cheek resumes cleaning as she departs.
Commuters bustle down the outdoor platform. Josh, eyes on paperback, nearly runs into Sarah.
Josh! Hey!
Sarah! They hug awkwardly. Sarah’s a bit flustered by his presen
I... It’s good to see you.
Yeah. Uh. You too.
Have you talked to Alex? Josh walks. Sarah follows him with her rolling suitcase.
No. But I can’t wait to ask the fucker what the hell he was thinking.
(horrified) You're not actually going to do that, right?
Why not?
Because he’s obviously... fragile!
How do you know? When was the last time you talked to him? (OFF Sarah’s look) Okay what do you propose? We all just tiptoe around?
How about we make him feel safe. And loved. And--
In other words pretend like nothing’s wrong. That’s bullshit and he’1l smell it. Sarah’s about to respond when...
Sarah! Josh! They find Siri. She and Sarah hug like the old friends th are. Siri looks at Josh. SIRI (CONT’D) We weren’t sure whether to expect you. Josh nods. Keeps his distance.
That jerk-off boyfriend of yours still mad at me?
I think he thinks you’re mad at him.
Jesus Christ how self-absorbed can one man be?
Don’t worry. You're still ina category of your own. Josh absorbs Sarah’s dart. Follows her towards Siri’s car
(sticking it right back) When are Isaac and his lady friend getting in?
Wait. Isaac is bringing a date?
His girlfriend.
I didn’t know he was seeing anyone.
It’s recent.
(rubbing it in) She's 22.
No she’s not.
What? It’s not like she’s 12.
One. You’re disgusting. Two. Why does he think it’s at all appropriate to bring her?
Why not? Young people are incredibly comfortable with voyeurism. Let’s just hope we can compete with Bravo. Josh gets in the car. OFF Sarah, still outside, stewing.
Isaac hands his CREDIT CARD to an EMPLOYEE, who walks awa process his rental agreement. Kate stands next to him.
Have you heard how he’s doing?
I don’t know. How do people normally do after things like this?

It depends. Most of the time they say they regret it. But there’s also a high rate of repeats. Isaac processes this information. They wait together in a moment of awkward silence. KATE (CONT’D) It’s okay that I’m coming, right?
You said you wanted to come and I said it’s fine. So, it’s fine.
No no no. I said I wanted to be there for you if you wanted me to be there. Should I not be here?
Of course you should be here. Everyone’s excited to meet you. The rental car employee returns with a CONTRACT and a SET
I’m so sorry, but all our premium class vehicles are unavailable. Could we interest you in one of our other options?
Yeah. Sure. Whatever has wheels.
I shouldn’t have come. Isaac sighs. Kate’s a bundle of nerves.
a + HH
+e HF FF

Ben approaches the bathroom door. He’s armed with a spong and bleach and dreading what kind of scene Alex may have behind. He steels himself. Opens the door to reveal... A QUICK YET DISTURBING GLIMPSE of dried blood in the bath clinging to the grout between the tiles. A bloody handpri Ben SLAMS the door shut. Before he can decide what to do hears Siri’s car PULL UP outside. Car doors OPEN AND SLAM

I’m just saying, it’s an objective truth: The Japanese are the most whacked-out people on earth. Josh and Sarah tumble in the dining room. Siri’s behind t with a BAG OF GROCERIES. Ben collects himself before join
You're like an eight-year-old racist.
Come on. Cram that many people on an island and it’s like a throbbing, inbred hothouse of cultural miasma. Frankly, I’m surprised they don’t have more fetishes. (noticing Ben) Ben Ben.
You came.
Yeah against my better fucking judgement. Josh keeps his distance. There’s a split second of tensio
Get the fuck over here. 19A Ben wraps Josh in a bear hug. Josh wrestles away.
Back me up here, Ben. We’re not really going to just pretend with Alex like nothing happened, right? All the levity of their greeting quickly vanishes.  12.
What are you supposed to say? “Hey Alex. Interesting choice to commit suicide.”
Thank you, Ben. Hi, by the way. Sarah and Ben hug.
I can’t believe you're on her side.
Hey. There are no sides. This is about Alex, remember? Everyone's momentarily chastened by Siri’s comment. Then start going at it again.
I think we should watch him.
What? Like... set up a monitoring system?
It'd be casual. But yeah, tag in and out. Have someone with him at all times.
We're his friends, not the Gestapo. This is ridiculous.
No, it’s not. I googled it.
Case in point. This conversation is making Ben more and more uncomfortab
I need to get some air. Ben walks outside. OFF the perplexed looks of the others.
Ben walks outside. Lights a cigarette to calm his nerves. runs smack into... Alex, stepping out of a taxi. Alex's face lights up when realizes who it is. Ben, for his part, looks stricken.
You came!
Course I did. Alex and Ben embrace. Alex starts back towards the house.
How you feeling?
I’m good! (a beat) Well, you know. Considering.
Alex. Look-- Ben halts things. Josh and Sarah’s LOUD VOICES from withi disrupt the moment.
Don’t tell me we’re having a party in honor of my suicide.
Jesus: attempt. If it were a suicide we’d both be wearing suits. Alex smiles. His whole demeanor is too upbeat and exagger to be believed. He opens the front door to find...
Josh and Sarah, mid-argument.

The first 48 hours are incredibly important. So if you can stop being such a-- (she notices Alex) Alex!  14. Sarah drops everything and rushes for him, holding him ti After a moment, Alex extracts himself.
Hey. It’s okay. Sarah wipes away a tear and nods. Alex looks to Josh.
You know, you could’ve just sent an email if you wanted us to visit.
Josh! But Alex smiles. Hugs Josh. Then has a moment with Siri.
We were going to pick you up.
Don’t worry about it. This was easier.
Do you want to sit down? Can we get you anything?
No, I’m good.
You sure? It’s awkward. Alex is projecting equanimity but underneat just wants to get away from everyone’s cloying concern.
Actually, I’m gonna go upstairs and get changed. Feel a little gross, if you know what I mean. Sarah shoots Ben a look. Ben realizes it’s his cue.
Here. Lemme come with. Alex shrugs, nonchalant. Ben follows him upstairs. The ot stare at each other, perplexed, until he’s out of earshot
Well he seems fine to me. Guess our work here is done.  22 15.
Clearly he’s in shock.
Way to act normal, by the way.
Way to be an asshole. OFF Siri, upset and irritated with both of them.

INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 22 Alex rummages for a fresh change of clothes while Ben tak in his Spartan accommodations: a bed, a desk, and a stack books by Wilde, Joyce, Eliot, and Pound.
Jesus, Alex. Is this your only blanket?
It’s warmer than it looks. Ben picks up a book and uncovers some LONGHAND SCRIBBLING
Why’d you leave LA?

I don’t know. Acting thing was only going okay. That city’s a fucking soul killer. And I just felt... Alex removes his shirt. There are bandages on his wrists an intensity in his look that wasn’t there a minute ago.
I mean, shit. I was running out of cash. My mom’s in fucking Bali. My dad had left me this. You and I'd kind of lost touch and--
Alex... about the calls... if I'd known-- Alex cuts him off.  23 16.
Hey. World’s got enough people you gotta explain yourself to. Alex throws on a fresh shirt and his demeanor is once mor disconcertingly jovial. He walks into the bathroom.
Remember junior year when you had that meeting with a publisher?
Yeah.
You were so late you had to run across campus, all drenched in sweat. I gave you my shirt so you’d look halfway presentable.
You walked home half-naked.
It’s just like old times, isn’t it? It’s crazy. OFF Ben, alone. Nodding but thinking it’s anything but.
INT. ‘SARAH'S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 23 Siri helps Sarah settle into a dusty room. Together they sheets on the bed.
If Josh is going to be like this all weekend...
He’s just dealing with it. In his own way.
And shouldn’t Isaac know there’s no such thing as a “plus one” to a friend’s failed suicide attempt? It’s not a fucking bar mitzvah.
Now you sound like Josh.  24 17.
God, you're right. How are you and Ben?
Fine.
Good fine? Okay fine?
I don’t know.
So not-so-good fine. Siri sighs. They both sit down on the half-made bed. SARAH (CONT’D) What’s up?
I’m... late.
Oh my God. Like how late?
Late late.
Does Ben know?
No.
Why not?

We're just... doing that thing where we snipe at each other. Silly stuff. It’1ll pass. The two girls look at each other. Sarah can tell that the more going on. Siri playfully whacks Sarah with a pillow.
Sarah sits down next to Alex.  18.
Hey. You need anything? Food? Water?
Still fine... Josh searches around for the bathroom but Ben cuts him of
Where’s the bathroom again?
Use the one in the upstairs hallway. Josh gives Ben a strange look. Sarah’s phone RINGS. Ben s down next to Sarah and Alex.
Hey Isaac, what’s up? (a pause) What’s the matter? Can your child bride not read a map? (another pause) Okay, okay!
That was a low blow. Sarah hangs up. Ignores Ben.
Isaac says he’s close but he’s lost.
(entering) I'll drive and meet them.
(getting up) I‘1l get some firewood. Josh?
Fuck it I’ll pee in nature. The two join Siri in getting ready to leave.
I’1l stay and watch Alex. Whoops. That just came out. Alex shoots her a look.  25 19.
(frustrated, embarrassed) I mean, I'll... put on some pasta. It’s awkward.
Ben places a log on a stump and wields a hand axe unstead
You clearly have no idea what you're doing.
Fuck you. Ben strikes the log, succeeding only in getting the axe stuck. Josh takes it from him and pries it loose.
Here. Josh splits a sliver off cleanly with a ferocious blow.
Lemme try again.
Uh uh.
Uh uh?
I taught you all of Calc 21 and then you did better than me on the final. I’m not teaching you how to chop wood.
I can’t help it if you have performance anxiety.
Hey. I can perform just fine.
Just let me try again.  26 20.
I got it.
Come on. Ben reaches for the axe but Josh won’t give it up.
I said, I got it. Josh raises the axe and delivers another blow.
Sarah channels her anxiety into chopping garlic at the ta while Alex unobtrusively plays sous-chef.
You don’t have to cook, you know.
It’s okay. It’s the one thing that relaxes me, actually. Alex hops onto the counter.
Really? Cause you don’t seem that relaxed.
It’s just been a while, you know? Since I’ve seen everyone.
You mean Josh? Or Isaac?
Yeah. Sarah crosses over to the counter, next to Alex.
If you need to get something off your chest, you should.
What is this? You try to off yourself and now you’re Oprah?  21. Sarah’s suddenly embarrassed. Turns back to her vegetable
No. God. I’m sorry. It’s just... sometimes it’s more complicated than that, you know?
Yeah. I know. They hear A CAR IDLING UP the driveway. Sarah crosses to window and they both spy on Isaac and Kate unpacking the
(fuck) She's hot.
Your boobs are bigger.
That’s not true.
Siri, Isaac, and Kate all burst in, bearing luggage. Alex walks over to greet them.
Alex.
You didn’t have to fly across the country.
Hey. I wanted to. This is Kate.
Hi.
Hey I’ve heard a lot about you.
I’ve heard a lot about you. It’s awkward. Kate wants to find a hole and hide. Josh en and CLOCKS Isaac’s leather shoes.  22.
What the fuck are those?
Is that how you say hi now?
They're shiny and pointy.
They’re Italian. So what? Ben has entered.
Isaac. If you’d told us you’d become a homosexual we could’ve thrown you a party.
(to Kate) I’m sorry. I was hoping to keep up the charade that my friends were normal for at least a few seconds. Josh grins.
Too late.
Is there a bathroom I could use?
Upstairs! Isaac gives them a strange look. Sarah enters. Hesitates second when she sees Isaac.
Dinner’s ready.
The whole group sits around a table eating Sarah’s pasta.
Sarah, this is delicious.  23.
It’s pasta and sauce from a can. Tomorrow I'll make something real.
Instagram tells me you're still cooking a lot.
Ugh. Instagram lies. Unless Ramen counts.
So being a lawyer's fulfilling all your hopes and dreams.
Not all of us can stand astride the planet on the backs of hedge funds.
Josh.

I’m just saying, we graduated at the onset of the worst recession in eighty years. History says most of us will never regain the income levels we might have otherwise enjoyed. Isaac here is a beautiful anomaly and for that we salute him.
Thanks Josh. How’s the PhD?
What’s that supposed to mean?
It’s a simple question.
But it had subtext.
You want the subtext?
Of course I want the subtext.  29
How’s life on your academic pedestal, reading books and despairing about the decline of our culture?
It’s comments like those that make me despair.
Seriously. What do you do all day?
I'm writing about the future of biography. How our ever-expanding digital footprint -- emails, texts, tweets, what have you -- will inform our “understanding of history and ourselves.”
Which is ironic.
Why?
Because I hate the modern world.
What era would you rather have lived in?
Honey. The only thing I hate more than the present is nostalgia for the past. The former roommates trade uncomfortable looks.
Ben does dishes. Isaac dries. Alex and Josh lounge.
(to Ben) You don’t have to do them all. 24. There’s a charged moment that could go either way. Isaac laughs it off.
It’s okay. He’s compensating for the fact that he can’t chop wood.
Since when did you become a bitter old man?
Around the same time you traded in for those shoes.
You know, this whole footwear smear campaign is cutting me deep.
Maybe you should commit suicide. (OFF the others’ looks) What? Too soon?
30 INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 3 Siri and Sarah help Kate settle into a room upstairs.
So how’d you meet Isaac?
It's... embarrassing. I was an intern. At his office. Sarah shoots Siri a look of disgust. Kate doesn’t catch i
But we didn’t start dating until after I left, of course.
Of course you didn’t.
Music plays. Everyone drinks. Sarah photo-abuses the othe with her iphone. Isaac busies himself on his Blackberry.
So how’s the novel, Ben?  26.
Good. Close to done.
Are we in it?
Yes and no.
Is tonight in it?
Not yet...
Tonight seems like it should definitely be in it.
Is it better or worse than your New Yorker story?
It’s without a doubt longer.
(snapping a photo) God I loved that story.
It’s the reason Siri agreed to go on a date with me.
No, it’s not. But it didn’t hurt.
I think I still have a copy here.
You know what? We should stage a dramatic reading.
That’s okay.
Why not? You can play the protagonist. I’1l be the roommate.
Really, Josh. It’s fine.  27. That came out harsher than Ben intended. He and Josh are worked up by talk of Ben’s story. Sarah takes another pho
Jesus can you stop with the photos?
I’m sorry. I’m recording the moment for posterity.
By ruining it in the present?
(snapping another one) You're an ass.
Come on. Both you guys--
What are you gonna do? Put ‘em on facebook?
I don’t know. Maybe.
You're clinically obsessed.
I like seeing what my friends are up to. So what?
So your News Feed tells you Isaac is enjoying a Merlot in Napa, or Ben wrote a funny headline for the Post, and you think that means you still know someone?
Josh. Sarah--
Yeah, I do. Because that’s what people do, Josh. People who care, at least.
Sorry but I’d rather be in the fucking dark about what people are up to than mistake some false level of intimacy for friendship.  28. Josh's words hang uncomfortably in the air.
We're still friends.
Isaac’s on his Blackberry sending work emails to San Francisco.
(stashing his phone) Fuck you.
Remember that time freshman year when we all got high and went to check out the glass flowers at the Natural History Museum?
You got so paranoid.
You had to talk me down. Kate notes their intimacy. Places her arm around Isaac.
What was Isaac like in college?
Dorky.
Uncultured.
Pretty much exactly as he is now. Kate kisses Isaac.
Then he must have been adorable.
What do you do, Kate?
I work at a suicide and crisis hotline for teens in the Bay Area. (a beat) Sorry. I didn’t realize how strange that would sound until it came out.  29.
(sarcastic) Shame I didn’t have your number. Could’ve solved all my problems. Kate looks at the ground and blushes. No one knows whethe rebuke Alex for his meanness. Siri stands up.
I’m going to bed. She gives Ben a look that means he’s meant to follow her.
Me too, I guess...
Already? Hey it is just like college! Ben begs him, “not now,” with his eyes before leaving.
Think they’1l get married?
Hopefully.
Why?
I want to go to a wedding.
You'd wish them eternal unhappiness in exchange for a cover band.
Who says they’d be unhappy?
The institution of marriage is inherently unhappy.
If anyone can do it, they can.
INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 32 Ben and Siri undress and lie down on opposite sides of th bed. A small universe separates them.
Why did you lie?
What? When?
To Alex. About the book.
I didn’t. I’m working on it. (OFF Siri’s stare) Because this weekend’s not about my problems, okay? But we can schedule one of those if you like.
These are your best friends, Ben. They’1l always be impressed by you.
Then they’re fucking idiots. (a long pause) He’d been calling me. A lot recently.
Who?

Alex. Always just checking in. Nothing much to say. Asking about the book, the book. It got to the point where I was screening his calls. When the hospital called I thought it was him again. And I... Ben chokes up. Can’t finish his sentence.
Hey. It’s not your fault.
But it kind of is, right? Ben look away from Siri. The gulf between them remains.
Kate’s fallen asleep next to Isaac on the couch. Sarah, A and Josh sit across from them, overtired and slaphappy.
Kate seems really sweet.
If you make one more comment...
What? I’m being serious! She looks as peaceful as a child. Alex, Sarah and Josh try to stifle their laughter.
That’s it. Bedtime. All of you.
I’m ready.
Lemme come up with you? Alex shrugs.
Alex and Sarah brush their teeth, jockeying for space.
Isaac carries a half-asleep Kate to their room.
Josh sits alone, rolling a joint. Lights it.
37 32. INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - NIGHT 37 Alex lies down and Sarah follows suit, her head in his la
It’s funny. All of us breathing under the same roof again. Do you ever wish we could just go back?
Sometimes. Actually, not really.
Why not?
I guess I was mainly just scared.
Of what?
Of you all. Of the possibility that you didn’t like me.
That’s ridiculous.

It’s the truth. I remember, that feeling, it didn’t go away until junior year. Ben had me at his parents’ place in New York for Easter. I don’t know what it was. It just felt like I'd entered this warm space, you know? We took the train there and back. Barely talked. It was better than talking. Sarah’s emotions swell. She sits up to look at him.
Alex, I don’t know how to say this but have you thought about therapy? ‘Cause I’ve done it a lot and--
You have? Why?
You know. Just stuff about how I’m constantly anxious but can never pinpoint why. (MORE )
How ever since college I feel like I can only be with guys who are assholes or married. Or both.
Has it helped?

Well. I take Xanax now. That does wonders for the anxiety. My therapist says the other stuff is very deep-rooted. (a beat) Oh my god. Here I am talking... I’m so self-absorbed. This is why I need therapy.
No, it isn’t. We just need sleep.
I know but... can I get you something? Are you okay?
Sarah. You’re going to have to stop asking me that.
INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 38 Isaac and Kate crowd together in a twin bed, spooning. Is is drifting off to sleep. Kate is wide awake.
Isaac... Isaac.
What?
Are you asleep?
Yes. Kate pauses.
What do you like about me? (a quick beat) You waited too long.  39 34.
Come on. I was thinking!
Well now I can’t trust what you say because it didn’t just come to you.
Are you being serious right now?
They all think I’m young and stupid. Maybe I am.
You’re neither. Now please. Stop. OFF Kate, unable to slow her spinning mind.
Sarah exits the bathroom and stumbles into Josh.
Whoa.
Sorry. I was just... Josh tries not to look at Sarah’s breasts.
What?
I was... watching Real Housewives of Atlanta the other week and--
No you weren't.
I was! It was on, I was there, I couldn’t look away, and then I thought, “This show, it’s really about the human condition and--
Josh. Shut up.  40 41 42 35. A pregnant moment. Then THEY’RE GOING AT IT, making out.
INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 40 Ben and Siri listen to A BED GROANING RHYTHMICALLY.
Sarah and Josh?
Like old times. Siri kisses Ben. He can’t get himself to engage. She brea it off and turns away, frustrated. Ben hates himself. He studies Siri’s beautiful back, but he can’t touch it.
INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 41 THE GROANING NOISE is even faster and louder now.
I thought they hated each other.
They do and they don’t. It’s a weird game they play.
Your friends are fucked up.
I think they prefer “complicated.”
